definition: local tyrant/local strong man/(slang) nouveau riche
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
local bosses, shady gentry (idiom); dominant local mafia

sentences.english: Of all the fugitive local tyrants and evil gentry, those who have fled to Shanghai are the safest.
sentences.chinese: 这些逃跑的土豪劣绅，以逃到上海的为最安全。

sentences.english: The provisions were obtained mainly from the war, the land owners, or by purchase or credit on the way.
sentences.chinese: 给养来源主要有战争缴获，打土豪筹粮款和购买借贷。

sentences.english: Everybody was for putting down the local tyrants and evil gentry.
sentences.chinese: 大家都赞成剥夺土豪劣绅的权力。

sentences.english: They have beaten down the local tyrants and evil gentry, big and small, and kept them underfoot.
sentences.chinese: 他们打翻了大小土豪劣绅在地上，并且踏上一只脚。

sentences.english: The first action I was involved in was an attack on a local exploiter.
sentences.chinese: 我参加的第一次行动是攻打当地的一个土豪。

definition: children of entrepreneurs who became wealthy under Deng Xiaoping's economic reforms in the 1980s/see also 窮二代|穷二代[qiong2 er4 dai4]
lit. stake a thousand pieces of gold on one throw (idiom); to throw away money recklessly/extravagant
lit. to squander money like dirt (idiom)/fig. to spend money like water/extravagant
big shot (leading some field or group)/godfather
"Ms Perfect" (i.e. fair-skinned, rich and beautiful) (Internet slang)
to parade one's wealth/to be ostentatious and extravagant
